title: 955-B
statement: B. Not simply beatiful stringstime limit per test1 secondmemory limit per test256 megabytesinputstandard inputoutputstandard outputLet's call a stringadorableif its letters can be realigned in such a way that they form two consequent groups of equal symbols (note that different groups must contain different symbols). For example,ababaisadorable(you can transform it toaaabb, where the first three letters form a group ofa-s and others — a group ofb-s), butccccis not since in each possible consequent partition letters in these two groups coincide.You're given a strings. Check whether it can be split into two non-empty subsequences such that the strings formed by these subsequences areadorable. Here a subsequence is an arbitrary set of indexes of the string.InputThe only line containss(1 ≤ |s| ≤ 105)consisting of lowercase latin letters.OutputPrint «Yes» if the string can be split according to the criteria above or «No» otherwise.Each letter can be printed in arbitrary case.ExamplesInputababaOutputYesInputzzcxxOutputYesInputyeeeOutputNoNoteIn sample case twozzcxxcan be split into subsequenceszcandzxxeach of which isadorable.There's no suitable partition in sample case three.

processed.result:
You are given a string of lowercase letters.  Determine if you can split the string into two non-empty parts such that:

* Each part consists of the same letter repeated multiple times. 

For example:

* "ababa" can be split into "aa" and "bb" which are both valid.
* "cccc" cannot be split this way.

Output "Yes" if you can split the string, and "No" otherwise.
Given a string of lowercase letters, determine if it can be divided into two non-empty parts where each part consists of the same letter repeated multiple times.
